thread.title: Child rapist who police quizzed over disappearance of Madeleine McCann dies in prison
thread.title_full: Child rapist who police quizzed over disappearance of Madeleine McCann dies in prison

author: Rachel Bishop
title: Child rapist who police quizzed over disappearance of Madeleine McCann dies in prison
text:
News Child rapist who police quizzed over disappearance of Madeleine McCann dies in prison Anthony Woodhouse 'died of natural causes' as he served a 17-and-a-half years sentence for raping a 14-year-old girl, it has been reported Share Madeleine McCann went missing in 2007 aged 3 (Photo: PA) Share Get daily   Thank you for subscribing!   
A sick child rapist, who police quizzed over the disappearance of Madeleine McCann , has died in jail. 
Anthony Woodhouse was serving a 17-and-a-half year sentence when he was found dead at Channings Wood jail in Devon today. 
Sources told The Sun that the paedophile – who was grilled by Scotland Yard for two hours over Maddie’s disappearance in 2014 – died of natural causes. 
Woodhouse had been due to stand trial in 1999 charged with raping a 14-year-old who fell pregnant with his baby, but fled the country and set up a cleaning business in Portugal. 
He was jailed in 2008 after giving himself up to the British Embassy in Lisbon claiming he felt guilty about his crime. Channings Wood Prison in Devon (Photo: Apex) Madeleine McCann (Photo: PA) 
Woodhouse was later visited by police trying to establish what happened to Maddie, aged three at the time of her disappearance in May 2007. 
An eyewitness claimed when Woodhouse walked down the corridor inmates would chant "give her back, give her back." Read More Apartment where Madeleine McCann vanished is 'bought by British gran for half the asking price' 
Judge Alistair McCreath told his trial at Worcester Crown Court: “This is as bad a case of rape that one can imagine and it is difficult to overstate how wicked it was. It is inevitable that the child was hugely damaged.” Parents of missing British child Madeleine McCann (Photo: Getty) Praia Da Luz Ocean Club Resort Madeleine McCann went missing (Photo: Sunday Mirror) 
A prison service spokesman said today: “HMP Channings Wood prisoner Anthony Woodhouse died in custody on Wednesday, March 1. 
“As with all deaths in custody, there will be an independent investigation by the Prisons and Probation Ombudsman.” Read More 
Madeleine was just three-years-old when she disappeared without a trace as her parents, Kate and Gerry, dined in a nearby tapas restaurant in the resort of Praia da Luz. 
They were on holiday with Madeleine and their two other children at the time. Like us on Facebook
